title: New ‘Variant of Concern’ Fuels Global Fear of Another Virus Surge
content: Scientists do not yet know how dangerous the new Omicron variant is, but its many mutations set off alarms, lowering hopes of putting the pandemic in the past.

more_info.byline: By Richard Pérez-Peña and Jason Horowitz

title: New Virus Variant Stokes Concern but Vaccines Still Likely to Work
content: The Omicron variant carries worrisome mutations that may let it evade antibodies, scientists said. But it will take more research to know how it fares against vaccinated people.

title: As Covid Infections Spread, Nursing Homes Lag Behind on the Rollout for Booster Shots
content: Thousands of new cases have been reported among vulnerable elderly residents in the last several months, as the virulent Delta variant fuels outbreaks.

title: Stephen Sondheim, Titan of the American Musical, Is Dead at 91
content: He was the theater’s most revered and influential composer-lyricist of the last half of the 20th century and the driving force behind some of Broadway’s most beloved and celebrated shows.

des_facet: Sunday in the Park with George (Play)
Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (Play)

title: Days Before Dying, Stephen Sondheim Reflected: ‘I’ve Been Lucky’
content: In an interview on Sunday, the revered composer and lyricist, 91, contentedly discussed his shows running on Broadway and off, as well as a new movie about to be released.

title: The Essential Musical Dramatist Who Taught Us to Hear
content: With a childlike sense of discovery, Stephen Sondheim found the language to convey the beauty in harsh complexity.

title: At ‘Company’ and ‘Assassins,’ Praise for Stephen Sondheim
content: “I would ask you to sit back and luxuriate in his extraordinary words and music,” the director John Doyle said before Friday’s performance of the “Assassins” revival.

more_info.byline: By Matt Stevens, Sadiba Hasan and Julia Jacobs

title: In Minneapolis Schools, White Families Are Asked to Help Do the Integrating
content: In a citywide overhaul, a beloved Black high school was rezoned to include white students from a richer neighborhood. It has been hard for everyone.

title: In a Picture-Postcard New York Town, Racist Incidents Rattle Schools
content: When students in Pittsford, a suburb of Rochester, returned to school in the fall, a disturbing video of a white student threatening to kill Black people renewed concerns about racism.

title: Afghan Economy Nears Collapse as Pressure Builds to Ease U.S. Sanctions
content: Afghanistan’s economy has crashed since the Taliban seized power, plunging the country into one of the world’s worst humanitarian crises.

title: A Cure for Type 1 Diabetes? For One Man, It Seems to Have Worked.
content: A new treatment using stem cells that produce insulin has surprised experts and given them hope for the 1.5 million Americans living with the disease.

title: Seeking Backers for New Fund, Jared Kushner Turns to Middle East
content: Former President Donald J. Trump’s son-in-law is trying to raise capital for his investment firm and is turning to a region that he dealt with extensively while in the White House.

title: Don Johnson Is Back as ‘Nash Bridges.’ Why?
content: The actor was already having a renaissance thanks to “Knives Out” and “Watchmen.” But 20 years on, Nash remains one of Johnson’s favorite roles.

content: Baking whole wheat bread can reacquaint us with food that truly nourishes us.

title: Self-Sufficiency Is Overrated
content: When I opened myself up to the generosity of others, even small kindnesses suddenly felt outsized in their humanity.

content: My children do not understand my world and I do not understand theirs.

title: Iran Forcefully Clamps Down on Protests Against Growing Water Shortages
content: The crackdown came after the protests spilled over to at least one other city and a major protest on Friday loomed. Weather experts say 97 percent of the country is dealing with water scarcity issues.

content: The police were trying to determine if the charred remains found in the capital’s Chinatown district were linked to the protests, in which demonstrators set fire to buildings.

title: A Feud Fueled by Social Media Is Also Made for TV

title: A Mine Disaster in Russia Highlights Safety Shortfalls in Rush to Dig Coal
content: At least 46 miners were killed in an explosion at a Siberian mine. The director of the mine has been taken into police custody, along with five other administrators.
